source_data.annotation: Be sure to consider how many 500 ml cultures you will need (controls, replicates) so you grow enough, up to 50 ml. Cellulophaga should grow at room temperature on the benchtop. Do this late in the workday (3-6 PM).

source_data.annotation: This is 'time 0', but check your timer and make a note of how much time has actually passed since phage addition. Each sampling should be completed as quickly as possible, so set up your plates, tubes containing buffer for dilutions, top agar, etc. before you start.

components.data: Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau before the burst (A)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau before the burst (A)

components.data: Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau after the burst (B)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau after the burst (B)

components.data: Subtract A from B; This is the total burst or new phages released (C)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Subtract A from B; This is the total burst or new phages released (C)

components.data: Divide C by the number of infecting phage (TOTAL phages at T0 minus FREE at T0); This is the burst size
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Divide C by the number of infecting phage (TOTAL phages at T0 minus FREE at T0); This is the burst size
